definitions.definition: As is acknowledged to be true ; by general admission ; confessedly .
examples: Admittedly , vandalism is a bit of a problem.
She was admittedly the one who killed the baron.

definitions.definition: Signals a concession followed by a counterpoint usually headed by but .
examples: It's only a theory, admittedly , but it might work.
Admittedly he can't swim, but he still loves going to the seaside anyway.

main_definition: As is acknowledged to be true ; by general admission ; confessedly .
secondary_definitions: ( conjunctive ) Signals a concession followed by a counterpoint usually headed by but .
